text: Other than Biology, I'm doing economics and graphics. Hoping to get all As by the end of A levels. I was told by my teacher that if i want to do just biology (not something like medicine or biomed) then i should get into one of the top universities. It would help get a job but there might be a struggle if i don't get to the right university.
Which a levels did you do and which university did you go to?

Getting into a top university will definitely help! It's something that employers will look at when you apply for jobs, especially if you want to do research because it is very competitive.

I did maths, economics, history and physics, and then studied economics at Nottingham university because it was the subject I enjoyed most...and the job prospects for an economics student were pretty good.

What universities have you applied to?
